title: Chettinad by the WatersideTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Chettinad by the Waterside Published on : Friday, August 21, 2015
Chettinad food enthusiasts are in for a culinary delight, starting this 21st August, with Waterside Café rolling out the ‘Flavours of Tamil Nadu’ food festival.Jabaraj T, the master chef in South Indian Kitchen at the Taj Hotels in Chennai, the protégé of Master Chefs Kannan and Natarajan, mostly popular for their magic touch in the specialty restaurant Southern Spice; will be hosting this festival.
Using expertise handed down from his ancestors, Chef Jabaraj has curated a menu especially for this food festival that includes an array of classics and signature dishes that represent the cuisine. Presenting quite an elaborate spread for a food festival; right from starters, mains and accompaniments to dessert, there is enough for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.
The Chettinad region of Tamil Nadu boasts of using a plethora of spices, enhancing the flavours of both their vegetarian and non-vegetarian fare, with a generous use of fresh ground masalas, and top it off with a boiled egg. The Chettinad delicacies are mostly eaten with rice and rice-based accompaniments such as dosais, appams, idiyappams, adais and idlis.
Authentic Chettinad dishes included in the menu of this positively delectable food festival are Kozhi Melagu, Meen Varuval, Karuveppillai Chicken Curry, Cinna Vengaya Vathal Kozhambu, Ambur Kozhi Biryani and Kothu Paratha among many others.
For those who relate to South Indian cuisine as much more than just idli, vada, dosa, chutney and sambhar, this is the food journey to take your palette through; an absolute feast to each of the senses!
Source:-TAJ
